content.question: A uniform rod is placed with its center of mass on a support. A cylindrical bucket is hung at a distance <math alttext="d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to the left of the rod’s center and a liquid of density <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is poured into the bucket up to a height <math alttext="h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. On the right side, another cylindrical bucket is hung at a distance <math alttext="d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to the right of the rod’s center and a different liquid of density <math alttext="rho sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is poured into the bucket up to a height <math alttext="h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The buckets each have radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and their masses are negligible. If the rod-buckets system is in equilibrium, what is the density <math alttext="rho sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of the fluid in the bucket on the right?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator rho sub 1, end sub, d sub 1, and denominator d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator rho sub 1, end sub, h sub 1, end sub, d sub 1, and denominator h sub 2, end sub, d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator rho sub 1, end sub, h sub 1, and denominator h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator rho sub 1, end sub, pi r squared, h sub 1, and denominator h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator rho sub 1, end sub, h sub 1, end sub, d sub 1, and denominator h sub 2, end sub, d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
